data.title: [Check_mk (english)] check_mk_agent without xinetd
data.meta_description: I've got a few systems that have been set up to use check_mk_agent without xinetd.  Running into a small glitch with that setup.  I'm running either Scientific Linux or RHEL on these systems, and have the EPEL repo setup…
data.text:
I’ve got a few systems that have been set up to use check_mk_agent

without xinetd. Running into a small glitch with that setup. I’m

running either Scientific Linux or RHEL on these systems, and have the

EPEL repo setup to get check-mk-agent. Whenever I see an update to that

package it wants to install xinetd as a dependency. I need to keep the

xinetd package from getting installed. Doing a --exclude and/or

–skip-broken in yum doesn’t get around this.

Is there a suggested method for getting the check-mk-agent package

installed and updated without xinetd?

–

Stephen Berg

Systems Administrator

NRL Code: 7320

Office: 228-688-5738

stephen.berg.ctr@nrlssc.navy.mil

checkmk-en mailing list

checkmk-en@lists.mathias-kettner.de

http://lists.mathias-kettner.de/mailman/listinfo/checkmk-en
